key_points: Anti-monarchists have gained confidence due to the declining popularity of Prince Charles and revelations from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle.
Prince Charles' favorability has decreased, with a significant portion of the public viewing him negatively.
Harry and Meghan's interview with Oprah Winfrey highlighted issues of racism and lack of support within the royal family, contributing to their decision to leave the UK.
The interview has sparked debates on the relevance and values of the monarchy, especially among young people and people of color.
Republican movement gains momentum, with calls for reevaluating the monarchy's future post-Queen Elizabeth II.
Royal biographers and historians discuss the potential impact of the royal family's internal conflicts and public perceptions on the monarchy's survival.
The monarchy's history of overcoming crises and adapting to change is cited as a reason it may endure.
Public opinion on the monarchy remains divided, with some support for abolishing it entirely.
Buckingham Palace's response to the interview was to address issues privately, maintaining the family aspect of the controversy.
The incident brings into question Prince Charles' future as king and the monarchy's ability to resonate with modern values.
spokespersons: Sarah Gristwood (Historian, Journalist, Novelist, and Tudor Biographer)
Nicoletta Gullace (Associate Professor of History, University of New Hampshire)
Carolyn Harris (Author and Historian, University of Toronto)
